intro: Lippia asperifolia, commonly known as roughleaf lippia, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale purple. It typically grows in dry, sunny environments such as grasslands and rocky areas. Lippia asperifolia is often used in traditional medicine for its potential aromatic and medicinal properties.
